newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine tax collection seen rising in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Argentine tax collection seen rising in 1997.

text.p: Argentine tax collection is expected to rise between eight and 10 percent to nearly $40 billion next year, Guillermo Rodriguez Use, undersecretary for tax policy, said Friday.
Use also predicted that tax collection in December will be $3.80 billion compared with $3.55 billion in the same month a year earlier.
In December value added tax collection will rise to $1.55 billion, up from $1.49 billion in December last year, while fuel tax income will come to $400 million, he said.
"The increase in value added tax will be felt in the first quarter of 1997 since there are still firms that are adjusting their stocks," Use told reporters.
